jade.core
Class Console

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  jade.core.Console
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Console
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.io.Serializable

This class allows the JPanel to have console functionality simular to what curses does in c. The api differs from curses but is fairly simple to use. Any changes to the screen are written to a buffer which then must be painted on the screen by use of the refreshScreen method. A second buffer is also provided to allow for saving and restoring of screen. A getKey method is also provided, which blocks until the next key press like getch in curses.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Console

public Console(int tileSize,
               int width,
               int height)
Constructs a new console with a specific starting size.

Parameters:
tileSize - the size of the tiles. The default is 12.
width - the number of columns. The default is 80.
height - the number of rows. The default is 24.

Parameters:

buffString

                       int y,
                       java.lang.String str,
                       java.awt.Color color)
Places a string in the buffer at the given location. This method does not wrap the text.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the string

echoString

public java.lang.String echoString(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   java.awt.Color color,
                                   char terminator)
This method is simular to echoChar, only that it repeats until the terminator char is pressed. The location that each char is placed is one to the right.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the first char to be buffered.
y - the y-coordinate of the first char to be buffered.
color - the color of the string to be output
terminator - the char of the key that ends the string
Returns:
the string that was entered.

getKey

public char getKey()
Returns the character of the next key press. This function will block until a key is pressed, simular to getch in c curses.

Returns:
the character of the next key press.

refreshScreen

public void refreshScreen()
Paints the current buffer to the screen.

onDeserialize

public void onDeserialize()
In order for getKey to work, console must know about the main thread. However, since Threads are transient, this method must be called upon deserialization to avoid NullPointerExceptions when using getKey.
